member_organisations: Cruelty Free International does not have members per se, but has donors and supporters from EU member states and beyond.
fields_of_interest: Trade, Consumers, Environment, Research and innovation, External Relations, Public Health
inter_groups: Regular participation in Animal Welfare Intergroup.
eu_initiatives:
- EU cosmetics policy 
- EU animal welfare policy issues 
- International trade policy, especially relating to research animals 
- EU policy relating to use of animals in scientific research  
- REACH  
- The development of alternatives to animal tests
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
http://www.eceae.org/ 
 
Parliamentary Group for Animal Welfare (APGAW - UK) 
 
Involvement in ECVAM (European Centre for the Validation of Alternative Methods) Stakeholder Advisory Forum; EPAA (European Partnership for Alternative Approaches to Animal Testing); ECHA (European Chemicals Agency) Risk Assessment Committee;  
- ICAPO (International Council on Animal Protection at the OECD); ICAPPP (International Council on Animal Protection in Pharmaceutical Programmes)
goals__remit: Cruelty Free International is working to create a world where nobody wants to or believes they need to experiment on animals.
relevant_communication:
- Regular newsletter updates on developments in the European Union 
- MEP petition against cosmetics animal testing, July 2017 
- Events surrounding the adoption of the cosmetics directive
legal_status: Company incorporated as private limited by guarantee
